con:soapui-project.name: Vertex_Tax_Calc

con:part.con:content: <wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="http://www.vertexinc.com/oseries/services/CalculateTax70" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns1="http://www.vertexinc.com/oseries/services/CalculateTax70" xmlns:vev="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" xmlns:wsdlsoap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <wsdl:types> <xsd:schema> <xsd:import namespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" schemaLocation="../xsd/7.0/VertexInc_Envelope.xsd"/> </xsd:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="calculateTaxRequest"> <wsdl:part element="vev:VertexEnvelope" name="part"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="calculateTaxResponse"> <wsdl:part element="vev:VertexEnvelope" name="VertexEnvelope"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="CalculateTaxWS70"> <wsdl:operation name="calculateTax70"> <wsdl:input message="tns1:calculateTaxRequest" name="calculateTaxRequest"/> <wsdl:output message="tns1:calculateTaxResponse" name="calculateTaxResponse"/> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="CalculateTax70SoapBinding" type="tns1:CalculateTaxWS70"> <wsdlsoap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="calculateTax70"> <wsdlsoap:operation soapAction=""/> <wsdl:input name="calculateTaxRequest"> <wsdlsoap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="calculateTaxResponse"> <wsdlsoap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="CalculateTaxWSService70"> <wsdl:port binding="tns1:CalculateTax70SoapBinding" name="CalculateTax70"> <wsdlsoap:address location="https://hottopic.ondemand.vertexinc.com:443/vertex-ws/services/CalculateTax70"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>

<xsd:schema targetNamespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.0" xml:lang="en-us" xmlns="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:include schemaLocation="tax/VertexInc-Common.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-Accrual.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-AccrualSync.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-APInvoiceSync.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-ARBillingSync.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-AssetMovement.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-BuyerInputTax.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-Delete.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-DistributeTaxProcurement.xsd"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> <xsd:documentation>The request used to accept a combined total tax amount for a purchase and distribute that tax to the appropriate jurisdictions. The combined rates for the taxing jurisdictions are used with the total tax amount to determine the taxable base and then redistribute the calculated taxes to each level for remittance. Vertex Central rules in effect as of the date in the documentDate attribute are used. If records for jurisdiction registration, product exception, or customer exception or exemption are dated on or before that date, they are used in the calculation process. Distribute Consumer Use Tax transactions are written to the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:include> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-DistributeTax.xsd"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The request used to accept a combined total tax amount for a purchase and distribute that tax to the appropriate jurisdictions. The combined rates for the taxing jurisdictions are used with the total tax amount to determine the taxable base and then redistribute the calculated taxes to each level for remittance. Vertex Central rules in effect as of the date in the documentDate attribute are used. If records for jurisdiction registration, product exception, or customer exception or exemption are dated on or before that date, they are used in the calculation process. Distribute Sales Tax transactions are written to the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:include> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-ERS.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-InventoryRemoval.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-Invoice.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-InvoiceVerification.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-PurchaseOrder.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-Quotation.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-Reversal.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-Rollback.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="indirect/VertexInc-Exists.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-FindChangedTaxAreaRequest.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-FindChangedTaxAreaResponse.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-ChangedTaxAreaRequest.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-ChangedTaxAreaResponse.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-FindTaxAreasRequest.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-FindTaxAreasResponse.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-TaxAreaRequest.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="taxgis/VertexInc-TaxAreaResponse.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="version/VertexInc-Version.xsd"/> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Vertex Envelope composite message. Declaration of structure and data types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:element name="VertexEnvelope"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Vertex envelope containing transaction information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Login" type="LoginType"/> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="AccrualRequest" type="AccrualRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accrual Request message. This request initiates a self-accrual calculation.This situation occurs when the buyer must remit tax on tangible personal property or services (used or consumed) when tax due on the transaction has not been paid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AccrualResponse" type="AccrualResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accrual Response message. This response returns the results of a self-accrual calculation. This situation occurs when the buyer must remit tax on tangible personal property or services (used or consumed) when tax due on the transaction has not been paid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AccrualSyncRequest" type="AccrualSyncRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accrual Synchronization Request message. This request initiates the reconciliation process for Accrual transactions between Vertex O Series and your host system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AccrualSyncResponse" type="AccrualSyncResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accrual Synchronization Response message. This response returns the calculation results for the reconciliation process for Accrual transactions between Vertex O Series and your host system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="APInvoiceSyncRequest" type="APInvoiceSyncRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accounts Payable Invoice Synchronization Request message. This request initiates the reconcilation of Accounts Payable invoices between Vertex O Series and your host system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="APInvoiceSyncResponse" type="APInvoiceSyncResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accounts Payable Invoice Synchronization Response message. This response returns the calculation results for the reconcilation process of Accounts Payable invoices between Vertex O Series and your host system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ARBillingSyncRequest" type="ARBillingSyncRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accounts Receivable Billing Synchronization Request message. This request initiates the reconcilation of Accounts Receivable transactions between Vertex O Series and your host system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ARBillingSyncResponse" type="ARBillingSyncResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Accounts Receivable Billing Synchronization Response message. This response returns the calculation results for the reconcilation process of Accounts Receivable transactions between Vertex O Series and your host system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AssetMovementRequest" type="AssetMovementRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Asset Movement Request message. This request initiates the calculation of consumer use tax on the movement of fixed assets from one tax jurisdiction to another. Whenever an asset is moved, the tax rates and rules forthe new location must be compared with the tax rates and rules for the old location. Reciprocity rules, which vary by tax jurisdiction, may need to be applied in these situations.
You can also use this message to initiate the calculation of value added tax on movement of fixed assets from one tax jurisdiction to another.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AssetMovementResponse" type="AssetMovementResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Asset Movement Response message. This response returns the calculation results for consumer use tax or value added tax on the movement of fixed assets from one tax jurisdiction to another.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BuyerInputTaxRequest" type="BuyerInputTaxRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Buyer Input Tax Request message. This request initiates the recording of Input value added tax paid to a seller or Import value added tax paid to customs or a third party. This message performs no calculation. It is used only to record the tax payment in the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BuyerInputTaxResponse" type="BuyerInputTaxResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Buyer Input Tax Response message. This response returns the status of the recording of Input value added tax paid to a seller or Import value added tax paid to customs or a third party.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DeleteRequest" type="DeleteRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Delete Request message. This message initiates the process of deleting transactions from Vertex O Series.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DeleteResponse" type="DeleteResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Delete Response message. This message returns the status of the transactions marked for deletion in Vertex O Series.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DistributeTaxProcurementRequest" type="DistributeTaxProcurementRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Distribute Tax Procurement Request message. This request initiates a Distribute Procurement calculation. It accepts a combined total tax amount for a purchase and distributes that tax to the appropriate jurisdictions. The Calculation Engine uses the total tax amount with the combined rates for the taxing jurisdictions to determine the taxable base, and then redistributes the calculated taxes to each level for remittance.
Use this request for a tax-only adjustment (debit or credit) to reconcile a tax underpayment or overpayment. The Calculation Engine uses the Vertex Central taxability rules that are effective on the date specified in the documentDate attribute. The Calculation Engine processes records for jurisdiction registration, product exception or customer exception, or customer exemption if they are dated on or before that date.
A Distribute Tax Procurement transaction impacts revenue unless you designate it as a tax-only adjustment. The Calculation Engine writes Distribute Tax Procurement transaction results to the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DistributeTaxProcurementResponse" type="DistributeTaxProcurementResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Distribute Tax Procurement Response message. This response returns the results of a Distribute Tax Procurement calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DistributeTaxRequest" type="DistributeTaxRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Distribute Tax Request message. This request initiates a Distribute Tax calculation. It accepts a combined total tax amount for a purchase and distributes that tax to the appropriate jurisdictions. The Calculation Engine uses the total tax amount with the combined rates for the taxing jurisdictions to determine the taxable base, and then redistributes the calculated taxes to each level for remittance.
Use this request for a tax-only adjustment (debit or credit) to reconcile a tax underpayment or overpayment. The Calculation Engine uses the Vertex Central rules that are effective on the date specified in the documentDate attribute. The Calculation Engine processes records for jurisdiction registration, product exception, or customer exception or customer exemption if they are dated on or before that date.
A Distribute Tax transaction impacts revenue unless you designate it as a tax-only adjustment. The Calculation Engine writes Distribute Tax transactions to the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DistributeTaxResponse" type="DistributeTaxResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Distribute Tax Response message. This response returns the results of a Distribute Tax calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ERSRequest" type="ERSRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Evaluated Receipts Settlement (ERS) Request message. This request initiates an ERS calculation.
Use the ERS request to calculate tax when a formalized agreement between the buyer and seller places the tax calculation burden on the buyer. In these situations, the seller does not issue an invoice. Instead, the buyer relies on pre-established terms (represented in a purchase order or other agreement) to calculate the tax due and remit payment directly to the seller. You must have a current knowledge of the seller's tax status (for example, where the seller is registered or has nexus) to assess tax at the proper rate.
In instances where the seller is not registered or does not have nexus in a taxing jurisdiction, the buyer determines the tax due and remits this Consumer Use Tax directly to the jurisdiction.
In Vertex Central, set ERS in the Procurement Business Event, in the Vendors > General tab, by checking the check box labeled Use Self-Billing.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ERSResponse" type="ERSResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Evaluated Receipts Settlement (ERS) Response message. This response returns the results of an ERS calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InventoryRemovalRequest" type="InventoryRemovalRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Inventory Removal Request message. This request initiates an Inventory Removal calculation.
Use the Inventory Removal message to calculate Consumer Use Tax when you are withdrawing inventory for a specific internal project or task. Consumer Use Tax that results from an Inventory Removal transaction should be accrued at the final destination location of the inventory.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InventoryRemovalResponse" type="InventoryRemovalResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Inventory Removal Response message. This response returns the results of an Inventory Removal calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InvoiceRequest" type="InvoiceRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Invoice Request message. This request initiates tax calculation on an invoice. Use this message to calculate tax at the time of shipping, billing, or invoicing from the seller's perspective. Because tax liability is typically incurred at the point of invoicing. Invoice transactions are written to the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InvoiceResponse" type="InvoiceResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Invoice Response message. This response returns the results of an Invoice calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InvoiceVerificationRequest" type="InvoiceVerificationRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Invoice Verification Request message. This request initiates an Invoice Verification calculation.
Use the Invoice Verification message to verify tax on incoming invoices to the buyer for tangible personal property, rentals, and leases. The invoice is recreated from the seller's perspective to validate that the proper tax has been applied.
The Invoice Verification message compares the total vendor-charged or supplier-charged tax amount from the original invoice to the Vertex-calculated tax amount. The Calculation Engine validates user-defined verification thresholds for tolerances at the transaction level. The Calculation Engine returns an indicator to the host system for undercharges and overcharges outside these settings. The invoice may display no tax if the buyer has filed a direct pay permit with the vendor or supplier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InvoiceVerificationResponse" type="InvoiceVerificationResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Invoice Verification Response message. This response returns the results of an Invoice Verification calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PurchaseOrderRequest" type="PurchaseOrderRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Purchase Order Request message. This message initiates a Purchase Order request.
Use a Purchase Order message to estimate the tax on intended purchases by a Buyer. The intended purchase of goods or services, including tax, is used as input to generate the purchase order. The ultimate use of the goods or services typically dictates the taxability of the purchase.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PurchaseOrderResponse" type="PurchaseOrderResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Purchase Order Response message. This response returns the results of a Purchase Order tax calculation on an intended purchase by the Buyer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="QuotationRequest" type="QuotationRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Quotation Request message. This message initiates a Quotation request. Use the Quotation message to estimate taxes on a proposed sale, rental, or lease of goods or services by the Seller. Quotations may be called from a CRM, Mobile Sale, Order Entry, or Internet Sale application. Quotation transactions are subject to change until an invoice is finalized. Consequently, Quotation transactions are not written to the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="QuotationResponse" type="QuotationResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Quotation Response message. This response returns the results of a Quotation tax calculation on an intended sale, rental, or lease by the Seller.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReversalRequest" type="ReversalRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Reversal Request message. This request initiates a process to reverse a financial transaction that has been posted to the Tax Journal in O Series.
You must specify the customer-defined Transaction ID that identifies the transaction to both the host system and O Series. A reversal creates a new transaction with taxable amounts that are the opposite value of the taxable amounts in the original transaction. The sum of the taxable amounts in the original transaction and the reversal transaction is 0.0.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReversalResponse" type="ReversalResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Reversal Response message. This response returns identifying information for the generated, offsetting transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RollbackRequest" type="RollbackRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Rollback request message. The Rollback Request message initiates a process to revert a previously synchronized O Series transaction to the state it was in before it was synchronized. Synchronization is the process by which O Series and your host system identify the correct status of a shared financial transaction. Transaction statuses are Active, Inactive, or Deleted.
You must specify the customer-defined Transaction ID that identifies the transaction to both the host system and O Series. This identifier is used for to all sychronizations of that transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RollbackResponse" type="RollbackResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Roll Back Response message.This response returns identifying information for the rolled-back transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TransactionExistsRequest" type="TransactionExistsRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Transaction Exists Request message. This message initiates a Transaction Exists Request that determines whether a transaction with a specified transaction ID is present in the Vertex O Series Tax Journal. Note: Transactions flagged as Deleted are considered to NOT exist in the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TransactionExistsResponse" type="TransactionExistsResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Transaction Exists Response message. This response returns the specified transaction identifier and an transactionExistsIndicator. This indicator identifies whether that transaction exists in the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FindChangedTaxAreaIdsRequest" type="FindChangedTaxAreaIdsRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Find Changed Tax Area Ids Request message. This request initiates a Find Changed Tax Area IDs request.
Use the Find Changed Tax Area IDs message to identify Tax Area IDs that have changed within a specified date range.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FindChangedTaxAreaIdsResponse" type="FindChangedTaxAreaIdsResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Find Changed Tax Area Ids Response message. This response returns the Changed Tax Area IDs within the specified date range.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IsTaxAreaChangedRequest" type="IsTaxAreaChangedRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Is Tax Area Changed Request message. This message initiates an Is Tax Area Changed request.
Use the Is Tax Area Changed event to determine whether a specified Tax Area ID has changed within a specified date range</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="IsTaxAreaChangedResponse" type="IsTaxAreaChangedResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Is Tax Area Changed Response message. This message returns Yes or No to indicate whether the specified Tax Area changed within the specified date range.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxAreaRequest" type="TaxAreaRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Tax Area Request message. This message initiates a single Tax Area lookup requested by an external system. Use the Tax Areas Request message to send a query to retrieve a single tax jurisdiction lookup. For example, you could use this event to retrieve the Tax Area IDs for a single postal address.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxAreaResponse" type="TaxAreaResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Tax Area Response message. This response returns the retrieved tax jurisdiction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FindTaxAreasRequest" type="FindTaxAreasRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Find Tax Areas Request message. This message initiates a Find Tax Areas request.
Use the Find Tax Areas Request message to send a batch query to retrieve multiple tax jurisdiction lookups. For example, you could use this event to retrieve the Tax Area IDs for multiple postal addresses.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FindTaxAreasResponse" type="FindTaxAreasResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Find Tax Areas Response message. This response returns the retrieved tax jurisdictions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VersionRequest" type="VersionRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Version Request message. This message initiates a request for Vertex O Series version information.
Use the Version Request message to retrieve version information from Vertex O Series for Vertex Product Support. Vertex Product Support uses this information in diagnostic and troubleshooting activities.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VersionResponse" type="VersionResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Version Response message. This message returns Vertex O Series version information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="ApplicationData" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logging information for this transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Sender" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the application that created the request message. This can be the logical location of the application and/or database server, the application, or the task that was processing to create the request message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="MessageLogging" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A group of logging parameters.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="OverrideLoggingThreshold" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When present, registers a logging threshold for the transaction. When request-handling is complete, this logging threshold is unregistered.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="LogLevelType"> <xsd:attribute name="thresholdScope" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Names a package scope for the threshold override. If absent, override threshold is global.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="returnLogEntries" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether to return the LogEntry elements in the response.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LogEntry" type="LogEntryType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A group of log entry data.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ResponseTimeMS" type="xsd:decimal" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The processing time in milliseconds. Use this information for troubleshooting performance issues.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:simpleType name="LogLevelType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Log levels indicate the severity of an error. The following log levels are listed from most severe to least severe.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="FATAL"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logs any system condition or event that jeopardizes system integrity, such as allocation failures, disk space errors, or major database problems.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="ERROR"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logs all abnormal events that are neither warnings nor fatal. Use this setting in a production environment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="WARNING"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logs any system condition or event that is abnormal but poses no risk to stability, performance, or answer quality.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="OPS"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logs major system events, such as starting up or shutting down of major system components or services.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TRACE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logs entry and exit points of substantial classes and services.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="DEBUG"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logs a detailed description of software execution. Use this setting only if you are working in a development environment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="SUPPORT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Logs pertinent details to enhance Vertex Product Support troubleshooting.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="LogEntryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Log entry type indicates the type of log entry.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Message" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The exception message text.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Exception" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The exception name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="logLevel" type="LogLevelType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The specific log level for this entry.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="instanceId" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The service instance that processed the request.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="threadId" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The thread that processed the request.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="className" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The class that generated the log entry.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>

<!--edited with XMLSpy v2013 rel. 2 (http://www.altova.com) by Vertex, Inc. (Vertex, Inc.)--> <xsd:schema targetNamespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.0" xml:lang="en-us" xmlns="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:include schemaLocation="VertexInc-Core.xsd"/> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../codelist/VertexInc-CodeList-DeliveryTerm.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../codelist/VertexInc-CodeList-JurisdictionLevel.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../codelist/VertexInc-CodeList-TaxingLocation.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../codelist/VertexInc-CodeList-TaxingType.xsd"/> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Core components used in the XML interface. Declararion of structures and data types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attributeGroup name="nexusExemptionGroup"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type of deduction that applies to sales that would normally be taxable but, because of special circumstances, are not. For example, the sale of machinery is normally subject to sales tax. However, when the machinery is used in manufacturing, some taxing jurisdictions consider the sale exempt. A certificate is usually required for an exemption to apply.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attribute name="nexusIndicator" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether the Seller is not required to collect taxes. In this case, all associated child line items are exempt from taxes. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to create and maintain nexus requirements.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="nexusReasonCode" type="ReasonCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code that indicates the reason that the Seller is exempt from tax. If your host system provides this functionality, this data element can be used. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to set up reason codes. Valid reason codes are expected from the host system and are pre-defined by Vertex for use in the Returns Export module in Vertex Central. Required (1) if the nexusIndicator is true. Note: To pass a standard (i.e., not user-defined) single-digit reason code, pad the code to four digits. Refer to the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide for information on exemption and deduction reason codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:attributeGroup> <xsd:attributeGroup name="BuyerGroup"> <xsd:attribute name="isTaxExempt" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional" default="false"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that the buyer is not required to collect taxes, and all line items associated with the purchase order are exempt from taxes. It is recommended that the buyer and vendor nexus requirements be created and maintained in the Vertex Central user interface. Note: This attribute is set to true if you pass an exemption certificate number in the XML message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="exemptionReasonCode" type="ReasonCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code that indicates the reason that the Buyer is exempt from tax. If your host system provides this functionality, this data element can be used. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to set up reason codes. Valid reason codes are expected from the host system and are pre-defined by Vertex for use in the Returns Export module in Vertex Central. Note: To pass a standard (i.e., not user-defined) single-digit reason code, pad the code to four digits. Refer to the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide for information on exemption and deduction reason codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:attributeGroup> <xsd:element name="AmountBilledToDate" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Certain states define a maximum tax amount that can be billed to a Lessee over the life of a lease. This field contains the amount the Lessee has been billed to date. The Amount Billed to Date enables you to determine the tax amount paid to date. When the tax amount paid to date reaches the maximum tax amount, the remaining billable amount for the Lease is non-taxable.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AssistedParameters" type="AssistedParametersType"/> <xsd:element name="CommodityCode"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A standardized, unique code for the product or service.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="EntityCodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="commodityCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of commodity code mapping.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CustomerCode" type="CustomerCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A user-defined code that represents the customer for the transaction or line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DispatcherCode"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A user-defined code that represents the dispatcher for the transaction or line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:restriction base="CompanyCodeType"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RecipientCode" type="CustomerCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A user-defined code that represents the recipient for the transaction or line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="VendorCode"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A user-defined code that represents the vendor (external seller or vendor) for the transaction or line item. Use the Vertex Central user interface to set up any taxability rules that apply at this level. This should be a parameter that is configurable to data from the host system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:restriction base="CompanyCodeType"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DeductionOverride"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details on the deduction override.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ExemptOverride" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount used to override taxability to partial or full exempt status. If this data element is used to pass an override amount from the host system, the calculation engine ignores any applicable exceptions or overrides set up using the Vertex Central user interface. Vertex recommends that you use the Vertex Central user interface to create and maintain exceptions and overrides rather than using this data element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="AmountType"> <xsd:attribute name="overrideExemptReasonCode" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code that indicates the reason for the override. If your host system provides this functionality, this data element can be used. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to set up reason codes. Valid reason codes are expected from the host system and are pre-defined by Vertex for use in the Returns Export module in Vertex Central. Note: To pass a standard (i.e., not user-defined) single-digit reason code, pad the code to four digits. Refer to the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide for information on exemption and deduction reason codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="4"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NonTaxableOverride" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount used to override taxability to partial or full non-taxable status. If this data element is used to pass an override amount from the host system, the calculation engine ignores any applicable exceptions or overrides set up using the Vertex Central user interface. Vertex recommends that you use the Vertex Central user interface to create and maintain exceptions and overrides rather than using this data element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="AmountType"> <xsd:attribute name="overrideNonTaxableReasonCode" type="ReasonCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code that indicates the reason for the override. If your host system provides this functionality, this data element can be used. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to set up reason codes. Valid reason codes are expected from the host system and are pre-defined by Vertex for use in the Returns Export module in Vertex Central. Note: To pass a standard (i.e., not user-defined) single-digit reason code, pad the code to four digits. Refer to the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide for information on exemption and deduction reason codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Discount"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details on the discount. To pass Discount information, pass either DiscountPercent or DiscountAmount, but not both.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="DiscountPercent" type="PercentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount to be applied expressed as a percentage. Required (1) if no Discount Amount information is supplied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DiscountAmount" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount to be applied expressed as an amount. Required (1) if no Discount Percent information is supplied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:attribute name="userDefinedDiscountCode" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A user-defined code that maps to a Vertex-supplied discount category. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to map your discount codes to discount categories.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ExemptionCertificate"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details on the exemption certificate.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="exemptionCertificateNumber" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The identifier of the exemption certificate, which is recorded in the Tax Journal. Vertex recommends that you use the Vertex Central user interface to set up and maintain Exemption Certificates. Note: If you pass an exemption certificate number in the XML message, the isTaxExempt attribute of the participant is set to true and the transaction is treated as exempt from tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InvoiceTextCode" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicator that alerts the host system of the need to add invoice text of a specific type to a line item. For a list of the codes and their meanings, see the Supporting Information section in the XML Integration Guide. Note: This transaction is considered to involve a VAT group if a value of 2 (Intra-EU Notice) is returned, the POS jurisdiction is an EU country, and the buyer and seller have the same registration number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="JurisdictionOverride"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details on the jurisdiction overrides.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="DeductionOverride" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="RateOverride" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="jurisdictionLevel" type="JurisdictionLevelCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The jurisdiction level of the overrides. Vertex recommends that you use the Vertex Central user interface to create and maintain jurisdiction overrides.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="impositionType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of imposition. impositionType can be Vertex-defined or user-defined in Vertex Central. impositionType enables you to set registration-level details during transaction processing.
Regstration can have multiple imposition types at both the Main Division and Country level. This is an optional attribute under the TaxRegistration element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AdditionalTaxesDue" type="AmountType"/> <xsd:element name="AdministrativeDestination" type="LocationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Vertex-defined term that is equivalent to the benefit received location in some service transactions. Required (1) for some service transactions at either the Transaction level or the Line Item level. If information is provided at both levels, the Line Item level information supersedes the Transaction level information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AdministrativeOrigin" type="LocationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Vertex-defined term that is equivalent to the following terms: order taken, order acceptance, place of principle negotiation, or place of business.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ChargedTax" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This value is used when the buyer has paid a portion of the tax due on the invoice but an undercharge scenario occurs that required a partial accrual of tax or additional use tax may be due depending on the jurisdiction and usage of the Purchase. The amount paid from the invoice verification process should be passed so that partial accrual can be applied. Additional consumer use tax will be automatically accrued.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Cost" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The actual basis cost to the purchaser for the materials of the asset. For manufacturers, this is the cost of the actual materials purchased for resale from outside suppliers. For wholesalers and retailers, this is the material cost of the property itself.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CurrencyConversion"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The rate (multiplier) used for converting the transaction currency amount to the filing currency amount. Pass in this value and the currency code (isoCurrencyCodeAlpha or isoCurrencyCodeNum) to have filing currency calculated if your configuration parameters are set up to do so.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:attributeGroup ref="isoCurrencyCode"/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Destination" type="LocationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Vertex-defined term that is equivalent to the following terms: ship-to, benefit received, first used, where used, primary place of use, principle use location, location of property, or place of use. Required (1) at either the Transaction level or the Line Item level. If Destination information is provided at both levels, the Line Item level information supersedes the Transaction level information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Dispatcher"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Dispatcher information. The dispatcher is described by the child elements and attributes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="DispatcherCode"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ExtendedPrice" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This field specifies the actual price of the line item. However, if quantity and unit price are supplied, this is not required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FairMarketValue" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The basis price at which the asset could be sold to the public. This is also known as the selling price or the value of the product for sale.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FlexibleFields"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Container for user-defined fields. Fields are provided for string values, numeric (double) values, and date values.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="FlexibleCodeField" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="25"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User-defined field for string values.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="FlexibleFieldCodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="fieldId" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier for a Flexible Code Field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:minInclusive value="1"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="25"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FlexibleNumericField" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="10"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User-defined field for double values.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:attribute name="fieldId" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier for a Flexible Numeric Field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:minInclusive value="1"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="10"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FlexibleDateField" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="5"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User-defined field for date values.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:date"> <xsd:attribute name="fieldId" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier for a Flexible Date Field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:minInclusive value="1"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="5"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Freight" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This field sets the freight charge associated with the line item. Note that the preferred method for dealing with freight is to create a separate line item with an item type mapped to one of the Vertex-provided Item Categories. However, using this method will calculate tax for the default Freight Item Category and roll it into this line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InputTax"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Information necessary for the calculation of recoverability of an input tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="TaxingJurisdictionLocation"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the jurisdiction where the tax is reported.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="TaxingJurisdictionLocationType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element ref="InputAmount"/> <xsd:element name="InvoiceTaxRate" type="xsd:decimal" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The tax rate as shown on the vendor invoice.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BlockingOverridePercent" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The recoverable override percentage of the blocking override on the Input Tax level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="PercentType"/> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PartialExemptRecoverableOverridePercent" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The recoverable percentage of a partial exemption. This field is populated only for transactions with a tax type of Value Added Tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="PercentType"/> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="isImport" type="xsd:boolean" default="false"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that the input tax is Import VAT. Defaults to false.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ImpositionToProcess"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Limits the taxes calculated for the transaction to a specific jurisdiction level and imposition type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="JurisdictionLevelCodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="impositionType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of imposition. impositionType can be Vertex-defined or user-defined in Vertex Central. impositionType enables you to set registration-level details during transaction processing.
Regstration can have multiple imposition types at both the Main Division and Country level. This is an optional attribute under the TaxRegistration element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InputAmount" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of Input Tax to be distributed. Negative numbers are permitted so that corrections may be processed</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="InputTotalTax" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of tax to be distributed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LandedCost" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Landed Costs are costs associated with transporting goods. They are additional costs beyond the merchandise cost of inventory incurred in purchasing and receiving items, for instance, freight, import duties, and customs charges. Landed Costs are added to the Extended Amount on a line item but are not subject to any discounts or adjustments</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OriginalCurrency" type="CurrencyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This represents the currency in which the original business transaction took place.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PreviousTaxPaid" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This value represents the amount of taxes paid previously on the asset. This information is needed to determine reciprocity rules between jurisdictions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PhysicalOrigin" type="LocationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Vertex-defined term that is equivalent to the following terms: ship-from or first removed. Required (1) for VAT triangulation at either Transaction level or the Line Item level. If Physical Origin information is provided at both levels, the Line Item level information supersedes the Transaction level information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Product"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code from the host system that identifies the product, material, service, or SKU number. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to map your products to Product Categories. If the supplied Product and Product Class information is not recognized by the calculation engine, a general category indicating TPP is assigned. Required (1) if no Product Class information is supplied. If both are supplied, Product information supersedes Product Class information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="EntityCodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="productClass" type="EntityCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code used to represent groups or categories of products or services with similar taxability. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to map your products classes to Product Class Categories. If the supplied Product and Product Class information is not recognized by the calculation engine, a general category indicating TPP is assigned. Required (1) if no Product information is supplied. If both are supplied, Product information supersedes Product Class information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Purchase"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code from the host application that identifies the product, material, service or SKU code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="EntityCodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="purchaseClass" type="EntityCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code from the host application that identifies a general classification of product, material, service or SKU code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Recipient"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Recipient information. The recipient is described by the child elements and attributes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="RecipientCode"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RateOverride"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The rate override percentage for the specified jurisdiction. Vertex recommends that you use the Vertex Central user interface to create and maintain exceptions and overrides rather than using this data element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"/> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReturnsFields"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Support the returns associated with your tax type. These fields allow you to pass in country-specific data to Vertex O Series for returns processing. This data is passed from Vertex O Series to your returns processing system. The value of the name attribute for country-specific fields is prefixed by the two-character ISO country code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ReturnsCodeField" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A text value for your returns. If you require a country-specific setting, preface this text with the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code and an underscore.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="name" type="xsd:string" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Returns Code field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReturnsNumericField" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A numeric value for your returns. If you require a country-specific setting, preface this number with the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code and an underscore.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:attribute name="name" type="xsd:string" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Returns Numeric field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReturnsDateField" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date value for your returns. If you require a country-specific setting, preface this date with the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code and an underscore.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:date"> <xsd:attribute name="name" type="xsd:string" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Returns Date field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ReturnsIndicatorField" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Boolean value for your returns. If you require a country-specific setting, preface this value with the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code and an underscore.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:attribute name="name" type="xsd:string" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Returns Indicator field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Quantity" type="MeasureType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The number of units included in the line item based on quantity and not a currency amount. This value is applied on a line item basis to the quantity level of the product. This application of tax differs from normal tax calculation because the tax amount/rate is applied at the quantity level of the item sold in the transaction and not to the purchase price. Required (1) if no Extended Price information is supplied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SitusOverride"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details on the situs determination overrides.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:attribute name="taxingLocation" type="TaxingLocationCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The address type to be used as the situs. Required if performing a situs override.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="StatisticalValue" type="CurrencyAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Used for trades in the European Union (EU). The statisticalValue is the invoice value for imports or purchases (Arrivals) or exports or sales (Dispatches), calculated at the national borders of the EU Member States. The statisticalValue applies only if you meet the threshold amounts defined by each Member State. This field is used in Intrastat reports.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubTotal" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Sum of all extended amounts for line items in the transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SupplementaryUnit" type="SupplementaryUnitType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A quantity used with commodity codes that require a unit of measurement other than kilograms. For example, a supplementary unit could be the number of pieces, liters, or cubic meters. This is a numeric field used for intrastat purposes on the line item level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Taxes" type="TaxesType"/> <xsd:element name="TaxOverride"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details on the tax override.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:attribute name="overrideType" type="TaxOverrideCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Classifies the override as taxable or nontaxable.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="overrideReasonCode" type="ReasonCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code that indicates the reason for the override. If your host system provides this functionality, this data element can be used. You can use the Vertex Central user interface to set up reason codes. Valid reason codes are expected from the host system and are pre-defined by Vertex for use in the Returns Export module in Vertex Central. Note: To pass a standard (i.e., not user-defined) single-digit reason code, pad the code to four digits. Refer to the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide for information on exemption and deduction reason codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxRegistration" type="TaxRegistrationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Registration information for Value Added Tax. Note: This transaction is considered to involve a group if the buyer and seller have the same registration number, the POS jurisdiction is an EU country, and a value of 2 (Intra-EU Notice) is returned for InvoiceTextCode.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Total" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Total tax amount of each line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TotalTax" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Amount of tax based on variables of transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="UnitPrice" type="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Unit Price is used in conjunction with the quantity to calculate an extended price, if one is not provided.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Volume" type="MeasureType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The volume of the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Weight" type="MeasureType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The weight of the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:simpleType name="ChainTransactionPhaseCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Chain Transaction Phase identifies a phase within a series of transactions in which multiple invoices are created with only a single movement of goods. The phase identifies the position of the transaction in a supply chain. Use Tax Assist rules to evaluate this indicator along with other transaction facts to set the title transfer value and determine an appropriate taxability conclusion.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="MANUFACTURER"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An entity that creates some good or tangible property.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="INTERMEDIARY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A third-party entity between the manufacturer that creates the good or tangible property and the final consumer of the good or property. This is a Domestic VAT scenario.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="FINAL"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An entity that is the final consumer of the good or tangible property. This is an Intra-EU, Zero Rate VAT scenario.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="CountryAlphaCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:token"> <xsd:pattern value="[A-Z]{2,3}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="EntityCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="ExternalJurisdictionCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="FlexibleFieldCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="InputOutputCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies whether tax is Input VAT, Output VAT, both Input and Output VAT, or Import VAT, according to the perspective of the transaction to allow for Reverse Charges.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="INPUT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Input VAT is the VAT you incur as part of the purchase price of your goods or services. This is the VAT paid to the Vendor on purchases.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="IMPORT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Import VAT is charged when goods are imported into one jurisdiction (country) from another jurisdiction (country). This is the VAT paid by the Importer of Record on goods brought in from another jurisdiction (country). The tax is paid at the time the goods clear customs unless they go into a suspended state. The tax would then be due when the goods enter into free circulation.
For VAT purposes, the jurisdictions (countries) in the EU are affiliated together as a trade block. The EU acts as a single jurisdiction (country) for VAT purposes. Specific territories that trade with the EU are excluded from VAT. These territories are the Island of Heligoland and the territory of Bsingen (Germany); Ceuta, Melilla, and Canary Island (Spain); Livigno, Campione d'Italia, and Tthe Italian waters of Lake Lugano (Italy); the French Overseas Departments of Guadeloupe, French Guiana, Martinque and and Reunion, and Monaco (France); Mount Athos, also known asa Agion Poros (Greece); land Islands, (Finland), the Isle of Man (United Kingdom); and Akrotiri and Dhekelia (Cyprus).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="OUTPUT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Output VAT is the VAT you add to the sale price of your goods or services. This is the VAT charged by the Taxpayer on sales.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="INPUT_OUTPUT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Input_Output is the code used to specify the application of a reverse charge. In this case, the buyer has accounted for the VAT due.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="InpuRegistrationIdType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="LocationCustomsStatusCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the customs status at a given location.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:enumeration value="FREE_CIRCULATION"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of goods which have been imported, where all the applicable documentation has been completed and the duties paid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="BONDED_WAREHOUSE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that goods reside in a Bonded or Customs Warehouse. A Bonded warehouse is a warehouse where goods on which duties have not yet been paid can be stored. The goods are stored under bond and in joint custody of the importer (or the importers agent) and the customs officers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="FREE_TRADE_ZONE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that goods are located in a Free Trade Zone (FTZ). An FTZ is one or more areas of a country where tariffs and quotas are eliminated, and bureaucratic requirements are lowered in hopes of attracting new business and foreign investment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TEMPORARY_IMPORT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that goods have entered the location on a temporary basis. Temporary imports are a procedure where goods may enter a custom territory, under specific conditions, free of duty for a limited time. Instead of duty, the importer posts bond for twice the amount of duty, taxes, and other related importation charges that would otherwise be owed. The importer agrees to export or destroy the merchandise within a specified time or pay liquidated damages, which are twice the normal duty.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="INWARD_PROCESSING_RELIEF"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that goods are subject to Inward Processing Relief (IPR). IPR is a method of obtaining relief from customs duties and VAT charges. This relief applies to goods imported from outside a country, processed, and exported to other countries.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="OUTWARD_PROCESSING_RELIEF"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that goods are subject to Outward Processing Relief (OPR). OPR is a method of obtaining relief from Customs duty. The relief applies to goods, imported from non-EU countries, which have been produced from goods which were previously exported from the EU.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="LocationCodeType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="LookupResultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of a Tax Area lookup.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="NORMAL"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The lookup returned at least one tax area.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="BAD_REGION_FIELDS"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The location information used during the lookup was incomplete or inconsistent.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="BAD_STREET_INFORMATION"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The street address used during the lookup was incomplete or inconsistent.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="IGNORED_REGION_FIELDS"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Some of the location information was missing during the lookup.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="MAX_TAXAREAS_EXCEEDED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The maximum number of tax areas was exceeded. The maximum number of tax areas that can be returned during a lookup is specified in the taxgis.jurisdictionfinder.MaximumTaxAreas parameter.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="MAX_FULL_ADDRESSES_EXCEEDED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The maximum number of full addresses was exceeded. The maximum number of full addresses that can be returned during a lookup is specified in the taxgis.jurisdictionfinder.MaximumFullAddresses parameter.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="MIN_AGGREGATE_CONFIDENCE_EXCEEDED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The minimum aggregate confidence level has been exceeded. The minimum aggregate confidence indicator for returning tax areas is specified in the taxgis.jurisdictionfinder.MinimumAggregateConfidence parameter.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="CONFIDENCE_INDICATOR_SUPPRESSED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The confidence indicator value indicates the strength of the Tax Area lookup result.
The confidence indicator was supressed because one of the following was true: (1) the ZIP Code was missing in a lookup for a United States address, or (2) the lookup was for an address in Canada.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="PRECEDES_CONFIDENCE_INDICATOR_FUNCTIONALITY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The confidence indicator feature has been disabled because the transaction date specified in the search criteria for this Tax Area lookup precedes the implementation date of the TaxGIS Confidence Indicator. The default date value is 20060501.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="MovementMethodCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates how assets are moved. If you do not specify this value, the Calculation Engine defaults to REGULAR.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="CONSIGNMENT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates transfer of goods from one country to another to create a stock that is held in the second country under the owner's control. The stock is available for sale to multiple customers. This condition applies to Asset Movement transactions only. Depending on the countries involved in the transaction, it may allow for the deferment of Value Added Tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="CALL_OFF"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates transfer of goods from one country to another to create a stock that is held in the second country for the use of a single customer. The stock is not intended for sale to any party other than the single customer. This condition applies to Asset Movement transactions only.
