Depending on the countries involved in the transaction, it may allow for the deferment of Value Added Tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="REGULAR"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that there is no special consignment stock or call off stock condition to be considered for tax calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="PointOfTitleTransferCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Title Transfer (or Point of Title Transfer) is the location where the title to goods actually changes hands from seller to buyer. This location is a contractual term and is included on the contract between buyer and seller. Title Transfer applies only to goods.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="ORIGIN"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Title Transfer for the transaction occurred at the point of origin. The buyer takes title at the origin and pays import tax when the goods clear customs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="IN_TRANSIT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Title Transfer is executed in transit (for example, on the high seas). In this scenario, no VAT is charged.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="DESTINATION"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Title Transfer is executed at the destination. In this scenario, the supplier is the importer of record and would be charged import VAT. Then, a domestic supply takes place between the supplier and the buyer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="ProcurementTransactionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the transaction type for a Procurement transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="RENTAL"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A transaction that results in the transfer of possession, not title, of tangible personal property (for consideration) to a customer for use. Rental time periods are typically shorter in duration as compared to leases. For some jurisdictions, rental and lease are synonymous.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="LEASE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A transaction that results in the transfer of possession, but not title, of tangible personal property (for consideration) to a customer for the customers use for a specified time period.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="PURCHASE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A transaction that results in the passage of title, possession, or service benefit to a buyer from a seller in exchange for consideration.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="ReasonCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The 'Reason Code' can be passed through the ERP application if functionality is provided, however most Lessee's will set up reason codes associated with Lessee's in Vertex Central by the tax department. The valid reason codes are expected from the calling application and are pre-defined by Vertex for use in the Tax Returns application.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="4"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="RegistrationIdType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="SaleTransactionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the transaction type for a Sales transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="SALE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A transaction that results in the passage of title, possession, or service benefit from a seller to a buyer in exchange for consideration.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="RENTAL"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A transaction that results in the transfer of possession, not title, of tangible personal property (for consideration) to a customer for use. Rental time periods are typically shorter in duration as compared to leases. For some jurisdictions, rental and lease are synonymous.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="LEASE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A transaction that results in the transfer of possession, but not title, of tangible personal property (for consideration) to a customer for the customer use for a specified time period.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="SimplificationCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies a special action on the transaction being processed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="CONSIGNMENT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates transfer of goods from one country to another to create a stock that is held in the second country under the owners control. The stock is available for sale to multiple customers. This condition applies to Asset Movement transactions only. Depending on the countries involved in the transaction, it may allow for the deferment of Value Added Tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="CALL_OFF"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates transfer of goods from one country to another to create a stock that is held in the second country for the use of a single customer. The stock is not intended for sale to any party other than the single customer. This condition applies to Asset Movement transactions only. Depending on the countries involved in the transaction, it may allow for the deferment of Value Added Tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TRIANGULATION"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Involves two sales of the same goods within the EU. Three taxpayers are involved and located in different Member States. Party A sells goods to Party B, who in turn sells the goods to Party C but has Party A ship the goods directly to Party C. Party A issues a zero-rated invoice to Party B. Party B issues a zero-rated invoice to Party C. Party C self-assesses the VAT due. The goods do not follow the invoice trail because they never go to Party B.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="REGISTRATION_GROUP"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the transaction as involving a VAT group. A VAT group consists of two or more corporate entities that have registered to be treated as a single taxable person for VAT purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="SyncronizationCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates how O Series updates line items in a synchronized transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="ADD"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>O Series synchronization adds a line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="MODIFY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>O Series synchronization modifies a line item. The line item to be modified must have existed on a previous transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="DELETE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>O Series synchronization deletes a line item. The line item to be deleted must have existed on a previous transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="TaxAreaIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies a specific instance of tax area. A Tax Area is determined by the geographic areas that correspond to a unique combination of taxing jurisdictions where the tax area's boundaries are derived from the overlay of the geographic areas that form the domain of those jurisdictions.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:minInclusive value="0"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="999999999"/> <xsd:totalDigits value="9"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="TaxCollectedFromPartyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The tax received from a taxable entity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="SELLER"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>In Supplies transactions, the Seller is equivalent to the Taxpayer responsible for collecting and remitting tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="BUYER"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>In Sales tax or Value Added Tax Supplies transactions, the Buyer is equivalent to the Customer receiving goods or services.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="TaxOverrideCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type that enables you to override the taxability that is set up in O Series for a line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="TAXABLE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the line item is subject to tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="NONTAXABLE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the line item is not subject to tax. You can indicate the reason in the overrideReasonCode attribute.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="TaxResultCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the result of a tax calculation, based on situs and item type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="TAXABLE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This result has a tax imposition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="NONTAXABLE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This result does not have a tax imposition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="EXEMPT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This result is exempt from tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="DPPAPPLIED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This result, due to its situs (Place of Supply) determination, applies a Direct Pay Permit tax imposition. A Direct Pay Permit is a document granted by a jurisdiction that allows a buyer to determine which of their purchases are taxable and which are exempt, and remit any tax that is due directly to the jurisdiction. When a buyer submits a valid Direct Payment Permit certificate to a seller, the seller is relieved of all responsibility for collecting tax from the permit holder. Tax is not calculated</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="NO_TAX"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This result has no tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="DEFERRED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This result, due to its situs determination, has a tax, but the imposition of the tax is deferred.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="TaxStructureCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type that contains the criteria for how O Series applies tax. The tax rules determine the tax structure O Series applies in a tax calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="BRACKET"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Tax is based on a the bracket tax schedule logic of a jurisdiction. Bracket tax schedules are provided through Vertex data updates.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="FLAT_TAX"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Tax is a flat fee amount that is applied uniformly to every transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="QUANTITY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Tax is based on either the number of units or the type of units in a transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="SINGLE_RATE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Tax is based on a single percentage rate.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TIERED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Tax varies, based on the levels of taxable amounts defined by the jurisdiction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="AssistedParametersType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>List of all parameters on the tax or line item that were assisted by one or more assisting services.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="AssistedParameter" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Element body is value for assisted parameter. Body may be date (yyyy-mm-dd), numeric (default format for long or double), boolean (true or false), or simple string.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="paramName" type="xsd:string" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Unique name by which the modified parameter can be identified.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="phase" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether the parameter was assisted pre-calculation or post-calculation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="PRE"/> <xsd:enumeration value="POST"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="ruleName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Tax Assist Rule that the Calculation Engine applied during transction processing. To return the Tax Assist Rule name, the returnAssistedParametersIndicator must be enabled. The ruleName is an attribute of the XML Response message AssistedParameter element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="originalValue" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The original value of the assisted parameter before the Calculation Engine applied a Tax Assist Rule. This is an attribute of the XML Response message AssistedParameter element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="BuyerType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The buyer for the transaction or line item. The buyer is described by the child elements and attributes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="TaxpayerType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="Recipient" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Destination" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="AdministrativeDestination" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="ExemptionCertificate" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attributeGroup ref="BuyerGroup"/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CompanyCodeType"> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="EntityCodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="classCode" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code used to represent groups of customers, vendors, dispatchers, or recipients who have similar taxability. Note: If you pass a classCode, you should not pass a TaxRegistrationNumber because the registration number does not apply to the entire class.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerCodeType"> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="CompanyCodeType"> <xsd:attribute name="isBusinessIndicator" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the participant is a business.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="PartyType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="CustomerCode" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Destination" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="AdministrativeDestination" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="ExemptionCertificate" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="isTaxExempt" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional" default="false"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that the buyer is not required to collect taxes, and all line items associated with the purchase order are exempt from taxes. It is recommended that the buyer and vendor nexus requirements be created and maintained in the Vertex Central user interface. Note: this attribute is set to true if you pass an exemption certificate number in the XML message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="exemptionReasonCode" type="ReasonCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The 'Reason Code' can be passed through the ERP application if functionality is provided, however most Lessee's will set up reason codes associated with Lessee's in the Vertex Central user interface by the tax department. The valid reason codes are expected from the calling application and are pre-defined by Vertex for use in the Tax Returns application. Note: To pass a standard (i.e., not user-defined) single-digit reason code, pad the code to four digits. Refer to the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide for information on exemption and deduction reason codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="InvoiceVerificationBuyerType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="TaxpayerType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="Destination" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="AdministrativeDestination" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="ExemptionCertificate" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attributeGroup ref="BuyerGroup"/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="JurisdictionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name that this jurisdiction is commonly known. For example, Pennsylvania.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="jurisdictionLevel" type="JurisdictionLevelCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The level of the jurisdiction for which the tax on the line item is applied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="jurisdictionId" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Vertex-specific number that identifies a jurisdiction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:minInclusive value="0"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="999999999"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="effectiveDate" type="xsd:date" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> <xsd:documentation>The date when the tax for the jurisdiction became effective.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="expirationDate" type="xsd:date" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date after which the tax for the jurisdiction is no longer effective.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="externalJurisdictionCode" type="ExternalJurisdictionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Jurisdiction code assigned by the relevant governmental authority.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="LocationType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="PostalAddressType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="CurrencyConversion" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="taxAreaId" type="TaxAreaIdType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Vertex-specific number that identifies a tax area. If the Tax Area ID exists in your host system, use that data to populate this data element in a request message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="locationCustomsStatus" type="LocationCustomsStatusCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customs status at this location.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="locationCode" type="LocationCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A value that can be used for tax return filing in jurisdictions that require taxes to be filed for individual retail locations.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="externalJurisdictionCode" type="ExternalJurisdictionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The jurisdiction code assigned by the relevant governmental authority.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="LoginType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>System Login. Declaration of structure and data types.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="UserName" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The User ID of the individual initiating the login.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="64"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Password" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The password associated with the User ID of the individual initiating the login.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="64"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TrustedId" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier supplied by an ERP.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="6"/> <xsd:maxLength value="16"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="MeasureType"> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:attribute name="unitOfMeasure" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unit of measure for the line item to be used in surcharges based on quantity and not price. For a list of the possible values, see the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide. If you pass a value that does not match the unit of measure for the quantity-based tax rule, that rule is not used. May be Required (1) to determine tax liability in some jurisdictions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="3"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="OwnerType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="TaxpayerType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="PhysicalOrigin" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Destination" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PartyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specialized participant to mark taxpayer in DOM.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SellerType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="TaxpayerType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="Dispatcher" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="PhysicalOrigin" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="AdministrativeOrigin" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attributeGroup ref="nexusExemptionGroup"/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="RuleType"> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:positiveInteger"> <xsd:attribute name="userDefined" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifier for user-defined rules. This identifier is useful for troubleshooting. The default value is False, Vertex-defined rule.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="salesTaxHolidayIndicator" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether this rule applies as a Sales Tax Holiday.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SupplementaryUnitType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A supplementary unit type used with commodity codes that require an alternative to Net Mass by Kilograms. For example, a transaction mayhave no weight unit type. However,there may be pieces, pairs, or liters. This field is used for intrastat purposes.This element is associated with the Supplementary Unit element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:attribute name="unitType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A unit type used with commodity codes that require an alternative to Net Mass by Kilograms. For example, a transaction may have no weight unit type but there may be pieces, pairs, or liters. This element is used for intrastat purposes and is associated with the Supplementary Unit element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxAreaLookupType"> <xsd:choice minOccurs="0"> <xsd:element name="TaxAreaId" type="TaxAreaIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Vertex-defined Tax Area ID for the jurisdiction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element ref="PostalAddress"/> <xsd:element name="ExternalJurisdiction"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The relevant governmental authority associated with the Tax Area ID.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ExternalJurisdictionCode" type="ExternalJurisdictionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The jurisdiction code assigned by the relevant governmental authority.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Country"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The country associated with the external jurisdiction code. You can use a Data Extract report to see the valid country values. (Refer to the Vertex Central online help for information on running Data Extract reports.)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xsd:date" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date that provides time perspective for a Tax Area lookup. Tax Area IDs returned for the lookup are based on the jurisdiction boundaries in effect as of this date. Defaults to the current date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="lookupId" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Internal identifier or sequence number for this lookup.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxAreaResultType" mixed="false"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Jurisdiction" type="JurisdictionType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element ref="PostalAddress" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="Status" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Represents the result of the lookup process.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="lookupResult" type="LookupResultType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of the Tax Area lookup.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AddressCleansingResultMessage" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The reason for the Address Cleansing failure.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="code" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The specific fault code for the Address Cleansing failure.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="type" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of the Address Cleansing result.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="taxAreaId" type="TaxAreaIdType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Vertex-specific number that identifies a tax area.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xsd:date" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date that provides time perspective for a Tax Area lookup. Tax Area IDs returned for the lookup are based on the jurisdiction boundaries in effect as of this date. Defaults to the current date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="confidenceIndicator" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the relative likelihood that a result of a tax area lookup is correct based on the lookup criteria.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:minInclusive value="0"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="100"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxesType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Taxes calculated by the transaction processing system.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Jurisdiction" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of jurisdiction to which a tax is applied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="JurisdictionType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CalculatedTax" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Amount of tax calculated by the calculation engine.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="EffectiveRate" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>For Buyer Input tax and Seller Import tax, this rate is calculated based on the Extended Price and Tax Amount (Import or Input) passed in the Request message. If you total the Extended Price and Tax Amounts before passing them in, this rate is an average.
For all other message types, this is the effective rate the system used to calculate tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:minInclusive value="0"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Exempt" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Amount of the line item not subject to tax due to exempt status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NonTaxable" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Amount of the line item not subject to tax due to nontaxable status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Taxable" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Amount of the line item subject to tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Imposition" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the imposition to which the relevant tax rule belongs. This is assigned either by Vertex or by the user when setting up a user-defined imposition in the Vertex Central user interface.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="userDefined" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifier for user-defined rules. This identifier is useful for troubleshooting. The default value is False, Vertex-defined rule.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="impositionId" type="xsd:positiveInteger"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Vertex internal identifier for the imposition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ImpositionType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type description assigned to the imposition. When multiple impositions are imposed within a jurisdiction, each must have a different type. This is assigned either by Vertex or by the user when setting up a user-defined imposition in the Vertex Central user interface.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="userDefined" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifier for user-defined rules. This identifier is useful for troubleshooting. The default value is False, Vertex-defined rule.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="impositionTypeId" type="xsd:positiveInteger"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Vertex internal identifier for the impositionType.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxRuleId" type="RuleType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier for the tax rule that was used in tax calculation. This can be used as a troubleshooting aid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BasisRuleId" type="RuleType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier for the basis rule that was used in tax calculation. This can be used as a troubleshooting aid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="MaxTaxRuleId" type="RuleType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An identifier for the Max Tax rule that was used in tax calculation. This can be used as a troubleshooting aid.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RecoverableRuleId" type="RuleType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The identifier of the applicable VAT Recoverability Rule for the line item. This Recoverability Rule determines the percentage of input VAT that is deemed to be unrecoverable. This is an optional child element of the Taxes element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CertificateNumber" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The certificate number associated with the line item tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="certificateType" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The certificate type associated with the line item tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RecoverableAmount" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of input or import tax that the buyer is able to recover on a transaction. This is the amount that the Buyer puts on their returns in order to recover these funds.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RecoverablePercent" type="PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The percent of the tax that is recoverable, as calculated based on passed in recoverable amount and tax. Expressed as a decimal: 1.0 for 100%, .8 for 80%, .5 for 50%, and so on.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BlockingRecoverablePercent" type="PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The recoverable override percentage of the blocking override on the Input Tax level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PartialExemptRecoverablePercent" type="PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The recoverable percentage of a partial exemption. This field is populated only for transactions with a tax type of Value Added Tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="UnrecoverableAmount" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of input or import tax that the taxpayer is not able to recover. It is lost, which is a true cost to the taxpayer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FilingCurrencyAmounts" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A grouping of filing currency converted taxability amounts.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="CurrencyConversion"/> <xsd:element name="FilingCalculatedTax" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The calculated tax amount for the line item, reported in the filing currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FilingExempt" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The exempt amount for the line item, reported in the filing currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FilingNonTaxable" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The non-taxable amount for the line item, reported in the filing currency</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FilingTaxable" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The taxable amount for the line item, reported in the filing currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FilingRecoverableAmount" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The recoverable amount for the VAT line item, reported in the filing currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FilingUnrecoverableAmount" type="AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unrecoverable amount for the VAT line item, reported in the filing currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SellerRegistrationId" type="RegistrationIdType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Registration ID for the Seller associated with this line item tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BuyerRegistrationId" type="RegistrationIdType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Registration ID for the Buyer associated with this line item tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OwnerRegistrationId" type="RegistrationIdType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Registration ID for the Owner associated with this line item tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DispatcherRegistrationId" type="RegistrationIdType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Registration ID for the Dispatcher associated with this line item tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RecipientRegistrationId" type="RegistrationIdType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Registration ID for the Recipient associated with this line item tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element ref="InvoiceTextCode" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="SummaryInvoiceText" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Additional information about a tax, to be returned to your host system after tax calculation. To supply a value for this field, you need to set up a post-calculation Tax Assist rule. Note: The text you add to this field is not stored in the Tax Journal.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element ref="AssistedParameters" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="taxResult" type="TaxResultCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>System determination of taxable status based on situs and item type. Note: Tax amounts with a value of Deferred are payable at a later time and should NOT be written to the invoice.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="taxType" type="TaxingType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>System determined tax type, based on situs, transaction type, and party role type (perspective).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="maxTaxIndicator" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that max tax was applied to this line item of the invoice.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="situs" type="TaxingLocationCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The situs determined by the calculation engine for the line item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="notRegisteredIndicator" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates that the taxpayer company is not registered in the taxing jurisdiction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="inputOutputType" type="InputOutputCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies whether tax is Input VAT, Output VAT, or both according to the perspective of the transaction to allow for Reverse Charges.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="taxCode" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A user-defined code for the tax, to be returned to your host system after tax calculation. To return a value for this field, set up a post-calculation Tax Assist rule.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="vertexTaxCode" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code that can be used to classify the transaction at the tax level for reporting or tax return filing purposes. The code is generated by the Calculation Engine for each line item after tax calculation. It can be used as a filter for reports or as an input for post-calculation Tax Assist rules. For detailed information about the contents of the code, see the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="reasonCode" type="ReasonCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code that indicates the reason for the exception that was applied to this tax. Note: For a tax with multiple tiers, O Series returns the reason code associated with the largest basis amount. Note: To pass a standard (i.e., not user-defined) single-digit reason code, pad the code to four digits. Refer to the Supporting Information section of the XML Integration Guide for information on exemption and deduction reason codes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="filingCategoryCode" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Provides additional classification of the transaction for tax returns and reporting. Codes are jurisdiction-specific. Note: For a tax with multiple tiers, O Series returns the filing category code associated with the largest basis amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:positiveInteger"> <xsd:minInclusive value="1"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="99999"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="isService" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the product is a service.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="rateClassification" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Vertex-defined classification of the applicable tax rule for returns filing purposes. Possible values are: Luxury Rate, Standard Rate, Reduced Rate 1, Reduced Rate 2, Reduced Rate 3, Reduced Rate 4, Reduced Rate 5, User Defined, Zero Rate, Outside the Scope.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="taxCollectedFromParty" type="TaxCollectedFromPartyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The party who is responsible for the sales tax. Note: Tax amounts with a value of Seller cannot be charged to your customer and should NOT be written to the invoice.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="taxStructure" type="TaxStructureCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the applicable tax structure when the transaction includes a flat fee or quantity-based fee. Valid values are BRACKET, FLAT_TAX, QUANTITY, SINGLE_RATE, and TIERED.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxgisRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Parent type for all Taxgis request messages</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxgisResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Parent type for all Taxgis response messages</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxingJurisdictionLocationType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="LocationType"> <xsd:attribute name="jurisdictionLevel" type="JurisdictionLevelCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the jurisdiction level to which the tax applies.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="impositionType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of imposition. impositionType can be Vertex-defined or user-defined in Vertex Central. impositionType enables you to set registration-level details during transaction processing.
Regstration can have multiple imposition types at both the Main Division and Country level. This is an optional attribute under the TaxRegistration element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxpayerType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="PartyType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Company" type="EntityCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the top-level legal entity for which tax exceptions may exist. The Vertex Central user interface is used to set up any taxability rules that apply at this level. This should be a parameter that is configurable to data from the host system based on an individual company's legal and tax requirements.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Division" type="EntityCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the mid-level legal entity for which tax exceptions may exist. The Vertex Central user interface is used to set up any taxability rules that apply at this level. This should be a parameter that is configurable to data from the host system based on an individual company's legal and tax requirements.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Department" type="EntityCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the low-level legal entity for which specific tax requirements and exceptions may exist. Use the Vertex Central user interface to set up any taxability rules that apply at this level. Based on your legal/tax liabilities at this level, map the appropriate host system parameter to this data element. If all of your tax exceptions are at the top- or mid-level entity, you may choose not to populate this data element. Note that this data element is also used to sort reports.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxRegistrationType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="TaxRegistrationNumber" type="RegistrationIdType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The tax registration ID number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NexusOverride" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="4"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Information for the nexus override.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:attribute name="locationRole" type="TaxingLocationCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The location for the nexus override.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="country" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the override applies at this jurisdiction level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="mainDivision" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the override applies at this jurisdiction level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="subDivision" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the override applies at this jurisdiction level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="city" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the override applies at this jurisdiction level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="district" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the override applies at this jurisdiction level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PhysicalLocation" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The physical location associated with the tax registration. Use the taxAreaId or address information to identify the physical location.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="PostalAddressType"> <xsd:attribute name="taxAreaId" type="TaxAreaIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Vertex-defined Tax Area ID for the location.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="isoCountryCode" type="CountryAlphaCodeType" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The 2-character or 3-character alphabetic ISO 3166 code indicating the country represented by the registration.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="mainDivision"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The proper name or postal abbreviation of the state, province, or territory of the tax registration.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="hasPhysicalPresenceIndicator" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether or not the entity has a physical presence in the country represented by the registration.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="impositionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of imposition. impositionType can be Vertex-defined or user-defined in Vertex Central. impositionType enables you to set registration-level details during transaction processing.
Regstration can have multiple imposition types at both the Main Division and Country level. This is an optional attribute under the TaxRegistration element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="0"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxSynchronizationRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Parent type for all Tax Synchronization request messages</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxSynchronizationResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Parent type for all Tax Synchronziation response message</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxTransactionRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Parent type for all Tax Transaction request messages</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TaxTransactionResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Parent type for all Tax Transaction response messges</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="VendorType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="PartyType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="VendorCode" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="PhysicalOrigin" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="AdministrativeOrigin" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="TaxRegistration" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema targetNamespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.0" xml:lang="en-us" xmlns="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Core components used in the XML interface. Declararion of structures and data types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attributeGroup name="isoCurrencyCode"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>ISO 4217 currency code structure</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attribute name="isoCurrencyName" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ISO 4217 name for the currency unit. Not used for this version of O Series.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="isoCurrencyCodeAlpha" type="Code3Type" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The three-character ISO 4217 alphabetic code for the currency unit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="isoCurrencyCodeNum" type="CodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The three-digit ISO 4217 numeric code for the currency unit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:attributeGroup> <xsd:simpleType name="AmountType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:decimal"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="PercentType"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:minInclusive value="0"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="1"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="CodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Simple type for 3-digit code values, such as the numeric code values used by the ISO 3166 standard</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:positiveInteger"> <xsd:minInclusive value="1"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="999"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code2Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Simple type for alpha-3 code values comprised of two capital Roman letters, such as the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:token"> <xsd:pattern value="[A-Z]{2}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Simple type for alpha-3 code values comprised of three capital Roman letters, such as the ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 standard.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:token"> <xsd:pattern value="[A-Z]{3}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="CurrencyAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A number of monetary units specified in a currency where the unit of currency is explicit or implied.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:attributeGroup ref="isoCurrencyCode"/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CurrencyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The monetary unit to be used in calculations as defined by ISO 4217 standard.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attributeGroup ref="isoCurrencyCode"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="DatePeriodType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="BeginDate" type="xsd:date"/> <xsd:element name="EndDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="DateTimePeriodType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="BeginDateTime" type="xsd:dateTime"/> <xsd:element name="EndDateTime" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="PostalAddressType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Postal Address declaration.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="StreetAddress1" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The first line of the street address.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="100"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="StreetAddress2" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The second line of the street address.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="100"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="City" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The proper name of the city used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). Optional (0..1) but recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="MainDivision" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The proper name or the postal abbreviation of the state, province, or territory used to determine the Tax Area ID if none is supplied. Optional (0..1) but is recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SubDivision" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the county used to determine the Tax Area ID if none is supplied. Optional (0..1) but is recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PostalCode" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The postal code used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). For valid formats, see the Supporting Information section in the XML Integration Guide. Optional (0..1) but recommended for greatest accuracy if no Tax Area ID is supplied.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Country" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The country used to determine the Tax Area ID (if none is supplied). You can use a Data Extract report to see the valid country values. (Refer to the Vertex Central online help for information on running Data Extract reports.) Defaults to the value of the taxgis.jurisdictionfinder.DefaultCountryCodeForAddress parameter. The default value for this parameter is USA. (For details on this configuration parameter, refer to the Configuration File Parameters Reference Guide.)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TimePeriodType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="BeginTime" type="xsd:time"/> <xsd:element name="EndTime" type="xsd:time" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="AmountType"/> <xsd:element name="Currency" type="CurrencyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Default unit of currency for the entire transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DatePeriod" type="DatePeriodType"/> <xsd:element name="DateTimePeriod" type="DateTimePeriodType"/> <xsd:element name="PostalAddress" type="PostalAddressType"/> <xsd:element name="TimePeriod" type="TimePeriodType"/> </xsd:schema>

Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved Delivery term specification. Declararion of structures and data types. An identifier that determines the vendor or customer jurisdiction in which the title transfer of a supply takes place. A Delivery Term Code identifies the importer of record on cross-border transactions. Also known as Shipping Terms or Incoterm. Delivery Term information is critical in Value Added Tax transactions to determine the place of supply, for example, in distance selling. For detailed explanations of these terms, refer to the Terms of Sales definition in the glossary of the U.S. Department of Transportation Maritime Administration Web site at http://www.marad.dot.gov/publications/glossary/T.html . Ex Works (EXW) Ex Works (EXW) Free Carrier (FCA) Free Carrier (FCA) Free Along Side Ship (FAS) Free Along Side Ship (FAS) Free Onboard Vessel (FOB) Free Onboard Vessel (FOB) Cost and Freight (CFR) Cost and Freight (CFR) Cost Insurance and Freight (CIF) Cost Insurance and Freight (CIF) Carriage Paid To (CPT) Carriage Paid To (CPT) Carriage Insurance Paid To (CIP) Carriage Insurance Paid To (CIP) Delivered at Frontier (DAF) Delivered at Frontier (DAF) Delivered Ex Ship (DES) Delivered Ex Ship (DES) Delivered Ex Quay Duty Unpaid (DEQ) Delivered Ex Quay Duty Unpaid (DEQ) Delivery Duty Unpaid (DDU) Delivery Duty Unpaid (DDU) Delivery Duty Paid (DDP) Delivery Duty Paid (DDP) Delivered at Place (DAP) Delivered at Place (DAP) Delivered at Terminal (DAT) Delivered at Terminal (DAT) Supplier Ships (SUP) Supplier Ships (SUP) Customer Ships (CUS) Customer Ships (CUS) Delivery term structure. Delivery term structure.

<xsd:schema targetNamespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Jurisdiction level specification. Declararion of structures and data types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType name="JurisdictionLevelCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the common classification of a jurisdiction, based on its geopolitical or taxing context.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> <xsd:enumeration value="APO"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Army and Air Force Post Office box. This value may also be used for Diplomatic Post Office (DPO) box.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="BOROUGH"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An entity that acts as a self-governing body on the local level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="CITY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An incorporated municipality in which definite boundaries and legal powers are set forth in a charter granted by the state.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="COUNTRY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An entity that acts as a self-governing body, based on a special common geographic area of interest</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="COUNTY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An entity within a state or country, used for administrative purposes, created by territorial division for the purpose of local government.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="DISTRICT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A local jurisdiction, which may or may not follow city or county boundaries, in which taxes or fees are imposed to benefit a specific purpose. Examples include Special Purpose Districts, Municipal Transportation Authorities, Transit Districts, Community Improvement Districts, Transportation Development Districts, Hospital Districts, Local Improvement Districts, Public Improvement Districts, School Districts, and Police Jurisdictions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="FPO"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>(Military) Field Post Office.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="LOCAL_IMPROVEMENT_DISTRICT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A municipality that provides local government functions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="PARISH"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An entity within a state or country, used for administrative purposes, created by territorial division for the purpose of local government (most often seen in Louisiana).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="PROVINCE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A territorial unit that acts in an administrative function or organized political system within a country. Provinces in Canada are similar to states in the United States.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="SPECIAL_PURPOSE_DISTRICT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A local jurisdiction that does not follow city or county boundaries. Examples include municipal transportation authorities (MTAs), hospitals, and school districts.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="STATE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A territorial unit that acts in an administrative function or organized political system within a country. States in the United States are similar to provinces in Canada.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TERRITORY"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A non-sovereign geographic region within a country.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TOWNSHIP"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An incorporated municipality in which definite boundaries and legal powers are set forth in a charter granted by the state, similar to a city.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TRADE_BLOCK"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A type of intergovernmental agreement where regional barriers to trade are reduced or eliminated among member countries.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="TRANSIT_DISTRICT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A special-purpose district organized as either a corporation authorized by statute, or a government agency that provides public transportation within a specific region.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:element name="JurisdictionLevel" type="JurisdictionLevelCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Jurisdiction level structure.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema targetNamespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.0" xmlns="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Taxing location specification. Declararion of structures and data types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType name="TaxingLocationCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the valid values for taxing locations that Vertex O Series uses when calculating tax.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="60"/> <xsd:enumeration value="ADMINISTRATIVE_DESTINATION"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Administrative Destination is equivalent to the Bill To: location. A common synonym is benefit received.
For service transactions in the U.S. and Canada, the administrative destination is the benefit received location and the destination is the service performed location.
For tangible personal property transactions, the administrative destination is examined when checking for the triangulation condition of an intra-European Union (EU) transaction from the buyer's perspective.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="ADMINISTRATIVE_ORIGIN"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Administrative Origin is equivalent to the Bill-From: location. Common synonyms include order taken, order acceptance, place of principal negotiation, and place of business.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="DESTINATION"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Destination is equivalent to the Ship-To: location. Common synonyms include benefit received, first used, where used, primary place of use, principal use location, location of property, and place of use.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="PHYSICAL_ORIGIN"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Physical Origin is equivalent to the Ship-From: location. A common synonym is first removed. A physical origin is required to perform triangulation in the case of value added tax transactions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:element name="TaxingLocation" type="TaxingLocationCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Taxing location structure.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema targetNamespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2012 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Taxing type specification. Declararion of structures and data types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType name="TaxingType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>These values are tax type enumerations.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:NMTOKEN"> <xsd:enumeration value="SALES"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A tax imposed on the privilege of making sales. Sales taxes are typically imposed on intrastate transactions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="SELLER_USE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A tax imposed on the amount charged for the transfer of title or possession of tangible personal property and/or services. The tax is collected when the seller and the purchaser are located in different taxing authorities.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="CONSUMERS_USE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Tax liability that is imposed on the storage, use, consumption, and, sometimes, distribution of property or services. Consumer use taxes typically arise when the seller that provides the goods or services is not registered to bill and collect the tax in a taxing jurisdiction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="VAT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Value Added Tax (VAT) is imposed on all possible entity types of taxpayer (such as individuals and enterprises) on the sale price of goods or certain services. VAT typically applies to the sale and importation of goods and also applies to processing, repair, or replacement services carried out in the taxing country.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="IMPORT_VAT"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Import VAT is charged when goods are imported into one jurisdiction (country) from another jurisdiction (country). This is the VAT paid by the Importer of Record on goods brought in from another jurisdiction (country). The tax is paid at the time the goods clear customs unless they go into a suspended state. The tax would then be due when the goods enter into free circulation.
For VAT purposes, the jurisdictions (countries) in the EU are affiliated together as a trade block. The EU acts as a single jurisdiction (country) for VAT purposes. Specific territories that trade with the EU are excluded from VAT. These territories are the Island of Heligoland and the territory of Bsingen (Germany); Ceuta, Melilla, and Canary Island (Spain); Livigno, Campione d'Italia, and the Italian waters of Lake Lugano (Italy); the French Overseas Departments of Guadeloupe, French Guiana, Martinque and and Reunion, and Monaco (France); Mount Athos, also known asa Agion Poros (Greece).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="NONE"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>No tax is imposed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:schema>

(Vertex, Inc.)--> <xsd:schema targetNamespace="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="7.0" xml:lang="en-us" xmlns="urn:vertexinc:o-series:tps:7:0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Copyright Vertex Inc. 2007-2013 All Rights Reserved</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../tax/VertexInc-Core.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../tax/VertexInc-Common.xsd"/> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Accrual transaction composite messages. Declaration of structure and data types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType name="LineItemATIType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Line Item declaration for Accrual Request message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Buyer" type="BuyerType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The buyer for the line item. The buyer is described by the child elements and attributes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Vendor" type="VendorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The vendor for the line item. The vendor is described by the child elements and attributes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element ref="TaxOverride" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="ImpositionToProcess" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element ref="JurisdictionOverride" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element ref="SitusOverride" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Purchase" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="CommodityCode" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Quantity" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Weight" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Volume" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="SupplementaryUnit" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="StatisticalValue" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="Freight" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="UnitPrice" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="ExtendedPrice" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element ref="ChargedTax" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This value is used when the buyer has paid a portion of the tax due on the line item but an undercharge scenario occurs that required a partial accrual of tax or additional use tax may be due depending on the jurisdiction and usage of the Purchase. The amount paid from the invoice verification process should be passed so that partial accrual can be applied. Additional consumer use tax will be automatically accrued.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element ref="InputTax" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element
